bibl.title: Despatch from Daniel R.B. Upton, June 24, 1859
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.ab: Consulate of the United States of America at Bathrust. 24th June 1859
div1.p: Sir, I have the honor to receieve your despatch the 7th March 1859, informing me, that the President had been good enough to promote me to the office of Consul, instead of Commercial Agent.
The bond has been signed by me and provided to New York, doe signatures of bondsmen, and will no doubt doon reach you.

As I have before inform- ed you (upon my being) app- -orished Commercial Agent) I was born in Paia, Brazil of American Pursuits and the Honorable John Appleton Assistant Secretary of State.
Washington

have resided nearly four years in this Colony-
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obident servant Daniel R.B. Upton United States Consul
